page.title: 07Macclesfield Forest Ecology
page.content:
ECOLOGY
{Conservation}- The Peak District National Park is responsible for the administration of conservation in this region, working closely with Cheshire County Council to preserve the natural beauty and encourage tourism. Regulations restrict any alterations to buildings, etc., which may be considered intrusive to Park users. In order to preserve the wild flowers in the area a portion of the grass round the Church is left uncut and in the porch is a list of wild flowers to be found in the local surroundings.
Macclesfield Forest, in conjunction with Wildboarclough, won the 1985 Best Kept Village Competition in their category.
